name: Accelerometer Demo [Godot]
description:
Disclaimer

I made it for studying purposes and I hope that it helps someone else to, it intents to overview some usage of things in Godot Engine, so it's not about the game itself .

I do not have authorship under any of the arts in this project. The arts are free to use for personal projects and some for commercial projects as well. All the owners of the arts are listed here and the link to the specific asset is also in the respective folders (as well as here).
I emphasize, however, if you want to use some art for personal projects that consult the author of the art. As for the code, the project is for study purposes and can serve as a basis for other projects. There is no need for credits.

Link to the pages where I obtained the visual resources for this project:

https://gamesupply.itch.io/fractal-backgrounds-2
https://gamesupply.itch.io/free-3-in-a-row-game-asset
https://vellidragon.itch.io/sokoban-clone-tiles
https://pzuh.itch.io/free-fantasy-game-gui

Features
  • Simple Labyrinth game
  •  Accelerometer
  •  GUI system
  • Save and load data
  • Level selection

  • Commented Code
How to play

If you downloaded the apk, you play it by using your cellphone accelerometer, if you downloaded the project you can use keyboard to movement test (and can export to cellphone, there's a file called readme that have two links to help with it).
